page.title: 10Trade-village shops
page.content: Facilities for shopping throughout this area are characterised by small village shops. Both{Cliffe}and {Hemingbrough}have{sub post-offices}and in addition have a number of different small shops of which the three described below are typical. {Hemingbrough Post Office}is situated in Main Street. It was opened there in 1981.The busiest time is mornings usually Thursdays.The busiest time of year is the first two weeks in December. The P.O. pays pensions, collects letters, weighs parcels and sells stamps; it is also a general store. Another popular shop is the {Fish and Chip Shop}which opened in 1982. The main shop in any village is the{General Store.}In Hemingbrough it opened about a hundred years ago and is still going strong. For big shops people travel to Selby, Goole or York.
